@hernan954

Sorry, that's just not true.

Per http://www.adobe.com/products/creativesuite/trial/faq/:

"Adobe Acrobat® 9 Pro is not available as a trial for Mac OS. Adobe Encore® CS5 software is not available as a trial. Encore CS5 will be installed as part of the trial for Creative Suite 5 Production Premium and Master Collection but will not be available for use until you purchase. The trial versions of Adobe After Effects® CS5, Adobe Premiere® Pro CS5, and Soundbooth® CS5 software do not include some features that depend on software licensed from parties other than Adobe. For example, some codecs for encoding MPEG formats are available only with the full version of these products."

-Trial doesn't include Adobe Acrobat, which is part of Master Collection.
-Features left out of Soundbooth, Premiere, and After Effects in the trial. From what I understand, these features are provided as downloads when you buy the full version from Adobe. 

However, someone mentioned on another torrent for Master Collection (http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5524722/Adobe_Creative_Suite_5_Master_Collection_MAC_OSX-HOTiSO), that if, for example, you start a Premiere project it will download the missing features automatically as needed. I have not tried this personally so I don't know if it works. I am not even sure you could download the stuff if you are blocking Master Collection from "calling home."

Oh, and another difference between the trial download and a full version: The trial version only includes 64-bit versions of Premiere and After Effects.

Per http://www.adobe.com/products/creativesuite/trial/faq/:

"If you decide to purchase Creative Suite 5 Master Collection, Creative Suite 5 Production Premium, Adobe Premiere Pro CS5, or After Effects CS5, complimentary 32-bit compatible versions of Adobe Premiere Pro CS4 and After Effects CS4 will be provided with your purchase."

Thanks for the great torrents. CS5 64 bit applications are so fast! I thought it would be useful to post step by step instructions (in following posts). You will notice that I recommend to "turn off Airport" during installation and to run "sudo dscacheutil -flushcache" after updating the /etc/hosts file. I'm not sure if these steps are necessary but I recommend to do so anyway. Also notice the link to Acrobat 9 Pro at the bottom of the post:

REMOVE OLD ADOBE INSTALLATIONS (IF APPLICABLE) BEFORE INSTALLING ADOBE CS5
Remove the following Adobe applications and files before installing the Adobe CS5 Master Collection:
/Applications/Adobe?	(everything with Adobe)
/Library/Application Support/Adobe
/Library/Application Support/FLEXnet Publisher
/Library/Preferences/com.adobe...	(everything with com.adobe)
~/Library/Application Support/Adobe
~/Library/Application Support/Adobe/Acrobat
~/Library/Preferences/Acrobat
~/Library/Preferences/Acrobat Distiller Prefs
~/Library/Preferences/Adobe...	(everything with Adobe)
~/Library/Preferences/com.adobe...	(everything with com.adobe)

INSTALLATION OF ADOBE CS5
Disconnect from network/internet (Turn AirPort Off). Double click "Adobe CS5 Master Collection.dmg" to install the Adobe CS5 Master Collection. Whilst installing CS5, ensure that you choose "Install this product as a trial" and DO NOT enter any serials. If you've already installed CS5 applications using a serial, load any of the installed CS5 applications and select Help > Deactivate. Quit all of the installed CS5 applications.

TERMINAL
Launch a Terminal window (in /Applications/Utilities) and copy and paste:
sudo /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts

Hit return and type your admin password.
The "hosts" file should automatically open in TextEdit.

TEXTEDIT
If the following lines are already part of the "hosts" file close it and continue with the "Finish" section. If not hit return (in the opened "hosts" file) and copy and paste following lines:
127.0.0.1 activate.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 ereg.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 activate.wip3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 wip3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 3dns-3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 3dns-2.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-2.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 ereg.wip3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 activate-sea.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 activate-sjc0.adobe.com

Save the "hosts" file, DO NOT Save As?.

FINALIZE ADOBE CS5 INSTALLATION
In Terminal copy and paste:
sudo dscacheutil -flushcache

Hit return (and type your admin password if asked for it). The Adobe activation servers are now blocked.

FINISH ADOBE CS5 INSTALLATION
Launch any of the installed CS5 applications and enter one of the following serials:
1325-0617-8365-2331-6662-9349
1325-0621-9125-0765-3648-0614
1325-0365-5929-6118-8817-8422
1325-0150-1163-7532-1626-3430
1325-0178-1927-9019-0123-2254
1325-0702-3693-1544-9166-3515
1325-0549-2240-0071-3409-1342

Connect back to network/internet (Turn AirPort On). You can start using CS5 applications.
Run any CS5 application > Help > Updates? multiple times until all installed Adobe CS5 applications are up to date.

ADOBE ACROBAT 9 PRO INSTALLATION
Download Adobe 9 Pro (not included in the CS5 torrent) from Demonoid
Adobe Acrobat 9 Pro can be installed by double clicking "Adobe Acrobat 9 Pro.dmg". After installation is finished install the 9.1.0 update by double clicking the "AcroProUpd910_all.dmg" installation package.
Launch Adobe Acrobat 9 Pro and enter the following serial:
1118-0011-0841-2246-4404-1353

Run Adobe Acrobat > Help > Check for Updates? multiple times until Adobe Acrobat 9 Pro is up to date.

I just wanted to add a few extra notes. In my first post (above) I show which applications, folders and files to remove to start with a clean system. A few notes:
1) / is the system root folder (which you can find in Finder by clicking on the hard drive icon at devices)

2) ~ is the User folder (which you can find in finder by clicking on the home icon at places)

3) I strongly recommend to delete the "/Library/Application Support/FLEXnet Publisher" folder if you have old Adobe applications installed. Keeping an old version of this folder can cause a variety of licensing errors. It will automatically be regenerated with the CS5 installation.

4) Obviously, if you're attached to your old Adobe application preferences, don't delete the preferences files in the system and User libraries. There is no harm in doing so, they'll be automatically regenerated but by deleting them you will loose your user preferences. I prefer to start with a clean system but that may not be the case for everybody.

5) Acrobat: If you follow the "removal list" in my first post you will also get rid of Adobe Acrobat. You can get the latest version from Demonoid (on the Demonoid website search for "Acrobat Pro 9.0 + 9.1 Update + SN").

@ciara10 Yes, you can indeed just keep Acrobat 9 if you have it installed already. Otherwise, just download the package from the Demonoid website (search for "Acrobat Pro 9.0 + 9.1 Update + SN"). @macbid I do assume that you have the Adobe server list blocked (see my earlier posts on the previous for details).

To fix your Acrobat problem:
- Delete the "/Library/Application Support/FLEXnet Publisher" and "/Library/Preferences/FLEXnet Publisher" folders.
- / is the system root folder (which you can find in Finder by clicking on the hard drive icon at devices)
- ~ is the User folder (which you can find in Finder by clicking on the home icon at places)
- Open the Acrobat or CS5 (or older CS4) application and re-enter the relevant serials for these products, respectively since the FLEXnet Publisher holds the licensing info.

See the my series of earlier posts on the previous pages for instructions on how to remove and reinstall all Adobe installations if you still have trouble.

@Ethnod Since it's a 5.62 GB torrent it won't fit on a single layer DVD (4.7GB) and you would need a double layer DVD (8.5 GB) providing that your burner can burn double layered DVD's. If so just burn the downloaded folder containing as such to the double layer DVD, copy the folder from DVD to the Mac and install by double clicking the dmg from the Mac hard drive. Much easier would be to get an 8 or 16 GB USB stick. I recently bought a 16 GB KINGSTON USB stick for $25 on Newegg. Also keep in mind that you'll Mac uses a different file system. It can read Window's FAT32 but FAT32 does not allow files larger than 4 GB, that would be a problem. Google for answers on a solution for that. My 2 cents.

Adobe Creative Suite 5 Master Collection
==========================================================================
Step 1 - Remove old Adobe CS4 before Installing Adobe CS5
Root folder
/Applications/Adobe? (everything with Adobe)
/Applications/Utility/Adobe?
/Library/Application Support/Adobe
/Library/Application Support/FLEXnet Publisher
/Library/Preferences/FLEXnet Publisher
/Library/Preferences/com.adobe... (everything with com.adobe)
Users folder
~/Library/Application Support/Adobe
~/Library/Application Support/Adobe/Acrobat
~/Library/Preferences/Acrobat
~/Library/Preferences/Acrobat Distiller Prefs
~/Library/Preferences/Adobe... (everything with Adobe)
~/Library/Preferences/com.adobe... (everything with com.adobe)

Step 2 - Disconnect from network/internet (Turn AirPort Off).

Step 3 - Install CS5 MC in Trial mode, select trial mode at the Welcome screen.

Step 4 - Edit the hosts file to prevent the Adobe registration client from contacting its servers.
============== activation server blocks ==============
A. open the terminal.app (found in Applications/Utilities/).
B. type "sudo -s" [without quotes]
C. if asked, type your root password and hit enter
D. type "pico /etc/hosts" [without quotes]
E. copy the list you find in the post of bookmarks (below) and past in your terminal (at the end of this hosts file)
F. ctrl+x to exit, y to save and enter to confirm the same name and modify your hosts file.

bookmarks list:
# Block Adobe Activation
127.0.0.1 activate.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 ereg.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 activate.wip3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 wip3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 3dns-3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 3dns-2.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-2.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 adobe-dns-3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 ereg.wip3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 activate-sea.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 activate-sjc0.adobe.com

Step 5 - Blocked activation servers
In Terminal copy and paste:
sudo dscacheutil -flushcache
Hit return (and type your admin password if asked for it).

Step 6 - Finish Adobe CS5 Installation
A. Start up any CS5 program again (I used Photoshop)
B. Punch in a new serial
============== CS5 Master serial ==============
1325-0617-8365-2331-6662-9349
1325-0621-9125-0765-3648-0614
1325-0365-5929-6118-8817-8422
1325-0150-1163-7532-1626-3430
1325-0178-1927-9019-0123-2254
1325-0702-3693-1544-9166-3515
1325-0549-2240-0071-3409-1342
1325-1558-5864-4422-1094-1126
1325-1958-5864-4422-1094-1178

============== Acrobat 9 pro serial ==============
1118-0011-0841-2246-4404-1353

EOF

Ok guys I have had some trouble getting this to work on lion but this is how I got it working after much trial and error!

1. open terminal
2. type this sudo nano /private/etc/hosts
3. copy the instruction stuff so it looks exactly like the example host file
4. CTRL+O
5. Enter
6. CTRL+X
7. flush as in the instructions
8. then Instead of trying to deactivate, just when it pops up with continue trial or register box just put in the key code provided in the instructions file... the bottom one worked for me!

~~~~~~

Everyone that has upgraded to Lion, Apple have locked the hosts file so using the old Sudo code won't work.

In order to access hosts now open terminal and enter (sudo nano /etc/hosts) Without the brackets of course.

Once you're in paste the text as it says in the instructions, you must use your arrow keys to scroll down and across inside the terminal. Once you have done this press ctrl + x followed by enter. Do not use cmd + S as this will only save the file into your documents.

Enjoy!
